body:
if our test suite doesn't complain about the changed mtime
by Debian's reproducible build script, why should we care
about changed mtime in the *.gz files.

The reason I dislike about changing *.gz is that it makes
the repo bigger (*.gz files are not compressible, so changing
the 120KB file will add 120KB to the repo, or does git do
delta compression on binary files too?)
